application.doc: Deleting a value from a configuration entry - Reverse Proxy

param.name: entry_id
param.doc: The name of the configuration entry. For example, https. Note: This name cannot contain the string "/value" unless it is the start of the entry name. ie "/value/name" is valid but "/name/value" is not.

param.name: value_id
param.doc: The value of the configuration entry. This field is optional and if it is not specified, all configuration entries with the matching stanza_id and entry_id are deleted.

method.name: DELETE
method.id: Delete Configuration Entry Value - Reverse Proxy Instances
method.doc: To delete a value from a configuration entry with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP DELETE command on the Reverse Proxy Instances resource URI. Configuration entries that are mandatory should not be deleted through the REST API.
